title: Aisha
summary: ʿĀʾishah bint Abī Bakr (Arabic: عائشة بنت أبي بكر‎ [ˈʕaːʔɪʃa], c. 613/614 or 603/604 – c. 678 CE),[lower-alpha 1] also transcribed as Aisha (/ˈɑːiːʃɑː/,[2][3] also US: /-ʃə, aɪˈiːʃə/,[4] UK: /ɑːˈ(j)iːʃə/)[5] or variants,[lower-alpha 2] was Muhammad's third and youngest wife.[7][8] In Islamic writings, her name is thus often prefixed by the title "Mother of the Believers" (Arabic: أمّ المؤمنين‎, romanized: ʾumm al-muʾminīn), referring to the description of Muhammad's wives in the Qur'an.[9][10][11]
